Running Unit Tests#

This section explains how to run unit tests for ManagerX using the pytest framework. It covers the necessary commands and options to execute the tests effectively.

Running Tests with pytest#

To run the unit tests for ManagerX, you can use the pytest command in your terminal. Make sure you are in the root directory of the project where the tests/ folder is located.

pytest tests/

This command will discover and run all the test cases defined in the tests/ directory and its subdirectories.

Specifying Test Files or Directories#

You can also specify a particular test file or directory to run tests from. For example, to run tests from a specific file:

pytest tests/test_example.py

Or to run tests from a specific directory:

pytest tests/unit/

Using Additional pytest Options#

pytest provides various options to customize the test run. Some commonly used options include:

  • -v or –verbose: Increases the verbosity of the test output.

    pytest -v tests/

  • -k <expression>: Runs tests that match the given expression.

    pytest -k "test_function_name" tests/

  • –maxfail=<num>: Stops the test run after a specified number of failures.

    pytest --maxfail=2 tests/

    pytest –cov=src tests/

This command will run the tests and generate a coverage report for the src/ directory.

Conclusion#

Running unit tests using pytest is straightforward and flexible. By utilizing the various options provided by pytest, you can tailor the test execution to suit your development and testing needs.
